Attention Elk Rapids Soccer Club Players and Families...

Online registration for our 2020-2021 season is now open!

In addition to registering to play, you may also sign up to coach and order jerseys.

For ERSC Registration, please visit link below to login or register (top right corner) to select player and program.

For U11+ teams we are anticipating the Fall and Spring Seasons will be $130 again. However, since we are currently unsure which league our teams will play and our ref fees we are splitting the cost into two $65 payments in case our assessments are less than previous years. Please select "Payment Plan" when you are checking out to complete the registration and initial $65 fee.

Contact ERSC Board if you have any questions. We look forward to getting everyone back on the fields!

NOTICE OF OPEN TENNIS

This coming Tuesday (7/14) we will begin to hold “Open Tennis” in the morning from 8:30am-10am at the HS courts. Due to the new Athletic Policy related to COVID we will be taking each player's and coach's temperature (with a non-contact thermometer) prior to beginning. We ask that if you have been at all ill please stay home. We will be logging each participant that chooses to participate and asking a few screening questions to ensure everyones safety. We will also be providing sanitizer to clean racquets and hands periodically. Please bring plenty of water to stay hydrated. All are welcome to come try to play so if you know of any friends that may want to play, bring them! If you have any questions please contact Coach Johnson...ljohnson@erschools.com, Coach Krakow...andreagkrakow@gmail.com or Coach Brown...jennie.b@outlook.com.

We are proud to share some exciting Elk Rapids Schools' Alumni news. Andrew Ducharme, our very accomplished Valedictorian for the Class of 2017, and son of Kathleen and James Ducharme, graduated yesterday from Loyola University.

He is graduating Magna Cum Laude with a Bachelor's Degree in both Physics and Math. He was honored with the Father VandeVelde, S.J. Memorial Award for demonstrating both an excellence in math and service to others. He was also honored with the Horan Physics Award as the top graduating physics student at Loyola University.

Until Fall, Andrew is working at the Argonne National Laboratory...the U.S. Department of Energy's Science and Engineering Research Center. He will then be heading west as Andrew has accepted a full ride scholarship to the University of Oregon's PPD program in Quantum Physics. While there, he will be mentored by David Wineland, a Nobel Laureate physicist.

We all wish Andrew much success and congratulations on his accomplishments. Excellence is truly part of the journey of this Elk!

As expected, yesterday Governor Whitmer canceled face to face instruction for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year due to the COVID-19 outbreak in Michigan. On Monday, April 6th, a district leadership team will begin developing the required components of our Elk Rapids Schools Remote Learning Plan. Our goal is to have the Remote Learning Plan approved by TBAISD as soon as the middle of next week. Once approved, communication regarding the details of our plan along with potential start dates will be shared with all district families. In the meantime, we encourage all our families and staff to stay safe and continue with the original distance learning we have utilized since the beginning of the school closure.

Warmly,

Tom Enslen

Elk Rapids Superintendent

Lakeland Elks Announcements and Events
January 6 at 11:40 AM ·

RoboElks win second tournament of the season!

The Cherryland Middle School robotics team RoboElks 41410A, won their second tournament of the season on December 21 at Kalkaska Middle School.

Team members, Xander Rich, Audrey Nicholson, Natasha Beebe and coach Kevin Kalchik have been working since last summer to build, program and practice driving their robot.

The RoboElks moved up through the qualification rounds through the day and were ranked in second place for the finals. During the final run, they scored 93 points and were presented with the Teamwork Championship Trophy.

This last October, the RoboElks put up a final score of 104 and won the competition at Rapid City Elementary. This win qualified the team to attend both the Michigan State Competition held at the Grand Traverse Resort and the US Open National Competition, held in Council Bluffs, Iowa. This is the second year this team is headed to the State Championship.

Congratulations to our RoboElks! And good luck at the championship.

The Positivity Project
January 21 at 12:52 AM ·

This week, our #P2PartnerSchools will focus on the character strength of perseverance. The concept of perseverance can most often be found in one’s active pursuit in overcoming obstacles. Perseverance is a uniquely human characteristic that identifies an individual’s ability to spend long periods of time devoted to a single goal or set of goals. Those who persevere are able to set goals for themselves and then take active, calculated steps toward those goals. People demonstrating high levels of perseverance are able to handle significant, sometimes repeated, setbacks in pursuit of goals.

#character #perseverance #otherpeoplematter
